item.title: U.S. Olympic and Paralympic officials bar transgender women from Olympic women's sports
item.description: The U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Committee tells the federations overseeing swimming, athletics and other sports that it has an "obligation to comply" with an executive order issued by President Trump.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: U.S. withdraws from U.N. cultural agency over 'divisive social and cultural causes'
item.description: U.S. State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce said the U.S. took issue with UNESCO's focus on the U.N.'s sustainable development goals and the decision to include Palestine as a member state.

item.title: National Urban League says Trump's policies amount to emergency for Black Americans
item.description: One of the nation's oldest Civil Rights organization warns the Trump administration's policies have thrust the country into a "state of emergency" for antidiscrimination policies, personal freedoms and black economic advancement.

item.title: Agence France-Presse says it wants to pull its hunger-stricken journalists out of Gaza
item.description: French news agency Agence France-Presse called on the Israeli government to allow its freelance journalists to leave the Gaza Strip because of worsening hunger.

item.title: Car makers are feeling tariff pain: GM is the 2nd company to take a hit to profits
item.description: The American automaker reported that tariffs cost them $1.1 billion and reduced the company's profit margin from 9% to 6.1%.

item.title: President Trump indicates he'll let Fed Chair Jerome Powell serve out his term
item.description: President Trump seemed willing to allow Jerome Powell to complete his term as chair of the Federal Reserve — at least for now. His comment comes as he and his administration continue to attack Powell.

item.title: Trump deflects questions about Epstein probe with accusations about Obama
item.description: President Trump is facing questions about the death of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. On Tuesday, he deflected by pivoting to long-held accusations about his Democratic opponents.

item.title: Cancer stole her voice. AI, curse words and children's books saved it
item.description: Sonya Sotinsky recorded herself talking and reading books to preserve a critical element of her personality: her voice. After surgery for oral cancer, AI used those recordings to re-create her voice.

item.title: Have all girls or all boys? Study suggests the odds aren't 50/50
item.description: A study analyzed decades of births and found that larger families showed a distinct tendency toward all girls or all boys, rather than a mix.

item.title: NPR news chief announces she's leaving days after Congress kills federal funding
item.description: NPR newsroom chief Edith Chapin says she's leaving the network. She made the announcement just days after Congress voted to strip public broadcasting of all federal funding.
